properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 1 at 11:21AM PST until January 1 at 9:47PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Washington...

Skokomish River near Potlatch affecting Mason County.

Olympic Peninsula Region

Heavy rains over the southern portions of the Olympics has caused the Skokomish river to rise above flood stage.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Skokomish River near Potlatch
* Until this evening.
* At 11:00 AM Wednesday the stage was 16.6 feet.
* Flood stage is 16.5 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring.
* Forecast...The river crested at 17.1 feet at 2 AM Wednesday and
will continue to fall to below flood stage early this afternoon.
* Impact...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread
flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West
Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. The evacuation route will
be opened to the west end of the Skokomish Valley Road.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
